headline.main: What LTE Means for Apple and the Wireless Industry

docs.snippet: The new iPad will be Apple's first mobile device compatible with so-called fourth-generation LTE networks. The introduction of this feature will help Apple buck Android competition, but its main impact will be on the carriers as they build out the...
docs.abstract: The new iPad will be Apple's first mobile device compatible with so-called fourth-generation LTE networks. The introduction of this feature will help Apple buck Android competition, but its main impact will be on the carriers as they build out the advanced network. The biggest potential loser may be Sprint.

docs.snippet: Eric Asimov's latest column in The New York Times on decanting wine reminds me that my own decanters see very little use - other than when they're used to water the plants. In my experience the French, outside the great temples of gastronomy, atta...
docs.abstract: Eric Asimov's latest column in The New York Times on decanting wine reminds me that my own decanters see very little use - other than when they're used to water the plants. In my experience the French, outside the great temples of gastronomy, attach less ceremony to the service of wine than, say, Americans, Britons or Germans do. So, when, then, to decant?
